title: High Point police officer, Winston-Salem teenager face weapons charges after accidental shooting
content:
A High Point police officer who lives in Winston-Salem and a teen were arrested Wednesday after an accidental shooting last month, Winston-Salem police said.
The shooting happened Jan. 16 at 3900 Thornaby Lane. Police said Isaiah Boyd, 16, was home alone and shot himself in the foot with a handgun. He had minor injuries.
During the investigation, police seized several unsecured firearms in the house. On Wednesday, Isaiah Boyd and High Point police officer Jeffrey Boyd, 48, were arrested. Isaiah Boyd was charged with possession of a firearm by a minor. Jeffrey Boyd was charged with failure to store firearm to protect a minor.
Police did not say whether Jeffrey Boyd and Isaiah Boyd are related. No other details about the shooting were released.
Capt. Mike Kirk of the High Point Police Department confirmed that Jeffrey Boyd is a police officer and that there is an internal investigation going on. Kirk said Boyd is still on active duty. He declined to comment further.
Isaiah Boyd and Jeffrey Boyd are scheduled to appear in Forsyth District Court on April 13.
